text: The 1934 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1934 college football season. Ninth-year head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 4–0–1 mark in the PCC and 4–3–1 overall. The Cougars played their three home games on campus at Rogers Field in Pullman, Washington; a road game was played in Spokane at Gonzaga. ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 29 | Montana | Home | 27–0 W | 7,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 6 | USC | Away | 19–0 W | 50,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 13 | Gonzaga | Away | 6–13 L | 11,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 27 | Oregon State | Home | 31–0 W | 13,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 2 | St. Mary's | San Fran. | 6–9 L | 20,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 10 | Idaho | Home | 19–0 W | 11,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 24 | Washington | Away | 0–0 T | 38,000 |- ! scope="row" | December 1 | Detroit | Away | 0–6 L | 6,000 |} :*One game was played on Friday (St. Mary's at San Francisco) ==References== ==External links== *Game program: Montana at WSC – September 29, 1934 *Game program: Oregon State at WSC – October 27, 1934 *Game program: Idaho at WSC – November 10, 1934 Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1934 in Washington (state)
